thread.title: Paddy Power troll Liverpool… with amazing 'end of season party' prank at Anfield
thread.title_full: Paddy Power troll Liverpool… with amazing 'end of season party' prank at Anfield

author: Richard Innes
title: Paddy Power troll Liverpool… with amazing 'end of season party' prank at Anfield
text:
Paddy Power troll Liverpool… with amazing 'end of season party' prank at Anfield Must have taken a brave man to put up this sign outside Anfield, ahead of Chelsea's visit Share Jurgen Klopp: unlikely to enjoy this (Photo: Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Remember when Liverpool were going to have a hugely successful season? 
Just a few weeks ago, Jurgen Klopp's side were flying. They were in the title race. They were in a very winnable League Cup semi-final. Liverpool supporters were convinced the glory days were returning to Anfield. 
Fast forward a few weeks to today and all of a sudden, The Reds' season is in danger of falling apart at the seams. Out of the League Cup, out of the FA Cup and - if they fail to beat Chelsea in the biggest clash of the Premier League week - out of the title race. (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
Ahead of the Chelsea game, perennial pranksters Paddy Power realised that this dramatic loss of form presented them with an opportunity to do what they do best: some comedy mockery. 
With the chances of Klopp's side winning a trophy basically over if they lose to Chelsea, the bookmakers decided to post this sign right outside Anfield: (Photo: Paddy Power) 
Assuming that defeat to Antonio Conte's team is inevitable, Paddy Power's jokers risked the wrath of Liverpool supporters by suggesting 21:45 on 31 January - the time the Chelsea match should finish - will be the perfect time for their end of season party. (Photo: Paddy Power) 
A Paddy Power spokesperson said: "Liverpool have Kopped a lot of stick after a disastrous week, which effectively ended their season already. Is the Klopp ticking for their German manager? Surely not yet, but if he continues to not be his usual efficient self, he could be off down the Anfield Road." 
So, how did the prank go down with the locals? 
"The initial stream of locals saw the funny side," the Paddy Power spokesperson told us, "but one shirt wearing fan saw Red and demanded we pull it down, or he would. "So we did, until he left at which point we put it back up! Eventually local police requested we remove it and we lost our bottle at that point…" Like us on Facebook
